enabled.description: Enable Trivy cleanup policy to delete old Trivy Operator reports
enabled.title: enabled

olderThan.description: Reports older than this duration will be deleted. Needs to be specified in hours. Defaults to 2 weeks (336 hours).
olderThan.title: olderThan

crds.description: We install CRDs through a Job with the helm specific crd folder.
crds.title: crds

global.description: Create PSPs for every component including the CRD install job
global.title: global

tag.description: Image tag Defaults to `latest` if omitted
tag.title: tag

kyverno.description: Additional options defined in charts/kyverno/values.yaml. Upstream docs: https://github.com/kyverno/kyverno

enabled.description: Pod antiAffinities toggle. Enabled by default but can be disabled if you want to schedule pods to the same node.
enabled.title: enabled

apiPriorityAndFairness.description: Change `apiPriorityAndFairness` to `true` if you want to insulate the API calls made by Kyverno admission controller activities. This will help ensure Kyverno stability in busy clusters. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/cluster-administration/flow-control/
apiPriorityAndFairness.title: apiPriorityAndFairness

createSelfSignedCert.description: Create self-signed certificates at deployment time. The certificates won't be automatically renewed if this is set to `true`.
createSelfSignedCert.title: createSelfSignedCert

extraContainers.description: Array of extra containers to run alongside kyverno
extraContainers.title: extraContainers

featuresOverride.description: Overrides features defined at the root level

backPressureThreshold.description: Max number of admission reports allowed in flight until the admission controller stops creating new ones
backPressureThreshold.title: backPressureThreshold

featuresOverride.title: featuresOverride

port.description: Service port. Kyverno's metrics server will be exposed at this port.
port.title: port

enabled.description: When true, use a NetworkPolicy to allow ingress to the webhook This is useful on clusters using Calico and/or native k8s network policies in a default-deny setup.
enabled.title: enabled

ingressFrom.description: A list of valid from selectors according to https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/network-policies.
ingressFrom.title: ingressFrom

podAnnotations.description: Additional annotations to add to each pod
podAnnotations.title: podAnnotations

minAvailable.description: Configures the minimum available pods for disruptions. Cannot be used if `maxUnavailable` is set.
minAvailable.title: minAvailable

unhealthyPodEvictionPolicy.description: Configures the maximum unavailable pods for disruptions. Cannot be used if `minAvailable` is set. maxUnavailable:
unhealthyPodEvictionPolicy.title: unhealthyPodEvictionPolicy

podLabels.description: Additional labels to add to each pod
podLabels.title: podLabels

extraResources.title: extraResources

enabled.title: enabled

scrapeTimeout.title: scrapeTimeout

tufRootMountPath.description: A writable volume to use for the TUF root initialization.

enabled.title: enabled

dnsPolicy.description: `dnsPolicy` determines the manner in which DNS resolution happens in the cluster. In case of `hostNetwork: true`, usually, the `dnsPolicy` is suitable to be `ClusterFirstWithHostNet`. defaultRegistry.title: defaultRegistry

enableDefaultRegistryMutation.description: Enable registry mutation for container images. Enabled by default.
enableDefaultRegistryMutation.title: enableDefaultRegistryMutation

excludeKyvernoNamespace.description: Exclude Kyverno namespace Determines if default Kyverno namespace exclusion is enabled for webhooks and resourceFilters
excludeKyvernoNamespace.title: excludeKyvernoNamespace

maxContextSize.description: Maximum cumulative size of context data during policy evaluation. Supports Kubernetes quantity format (e.g., 100Mi, 2Gi) or plain bytes (e.g., 2097152). Limits memory used by context variables to prevent unbounded growth. Increase if policies legitimately need large context data (e.g., processing large ConfigMaps). Set to 0 to disable the limit (not recommended for production).
maxContextSize.title: maxContextSize

resourceFiltersExclude.description: resourceFilters exclude list Items to exclude from config.resourceFilters
resourceFiltersExclude.title: resourceFiltersExclude

resourceFiltersExcludeNamespaces.description: resourceFilter namespace exclude Namespaces to exclude from the default resourceFilters
resourceFiltersExcludeNamespaces.title: resourceFiltersExcludeNamespaces

resourceFiltersInclude.description: resourceFilters include list Items to include to config.resourceFilters
resourceFiltersInclude.title: resourceFiltersInclude

resourceFiltersIncludeNamespaces.description: resourceFilter namespace include Namespaces to include to the default resourceFilters
resourceFiltersIncludeNamespaces.title: resourceFiltersIncludeNamespaces

webhooks.description: Defines the `namespaceSelector`/`objectSelector` in the webhook configurations. The Kyverno namespace is excluded if `excludeKyvernoNamespace` is `true` (default)
webhooks.title: webhooks

install.description: We manage CRDs with an outside job so this needs to be disabled
install.title: install

skipResourceFilters.description: Skips resource filters in background scan
skipResourceFilters.title: skipResourceFilters

bindAddress.description: Bind address for controller-runtime metrics (use "0" to disable it)
bindAddress.title: bindAddress

maxApiCallResponseLength.description: Maximum allowed response size from API Calls. A value of 0 bypasses checks (not recommended)
maxApiCallResponseLength.title: maxApiCallResponseLength

eventTypes.description: Events which should not be emitted (possible values `PolicyViolation`, `PolicyApplied`, `PolicyError`, and `PolicySkipped`)
eventTypes.title: eventTypes

namespace.description: Restrict policy exceptions to a single namespace
namespace.title: namespace

reconciliationInterval.description: Reconciliation interval for the label based cleanup manager
reconciliationInterval.title: reconciliationInterval

exclude.title: exclude

include.description: List of namespaces to capture metrics for.
include.title: include

enableAwsCloudControllerManagerPolex.description: Deploy a PolicyException for AWS Cloud Controller Manager (required for Giant Swarm clusters).
enableAwsCloudControllerManagerPolex.title: enableAwsCloudControllerManagerPolex

enableAwsEbsCsiDriverPolex.description: Deploy a PolicyException for AWS Ebs Csi Driver (required for Giant Swarm clusters).
enableAwsEbsCsiDriverPolex.title: enableAwsEbsCsiDriverPolex

enableAzureCloudControllerManagerPolex.description: Deploy a PolicyException for Azure Cloud Controller Manager (required for Giant Swarm clusters).
enableAzureCloudControllerManagerPolex.title: enableAzureCloudControllerManagerPolex

enableAzureCloudNodeManagerPolex.description: Deploy a PolicyException for Azure Cloud Node Manager (required for Giant Swarm clusters).
enableAzureCloudNodeManagerPolex.title: enableAzureCloudNodeManagerPolex

enableChartOperatorPolex.description: Deploy a PolicyException for chart-operator (required for Giant Swarm clusters).
enableChartOperatorPolex.title: enableChartOperatorPolex

enableCiliumPolex.description: Deploy a PolicyException for cilium (required for Giant Swarm clusters).
enableCiliumPolex.title: enableCiliumPolex

enableNoisyContextsPolicy.description: Most Pod-level policies shouldn't depend on external calls, and the extra API calls can cause cascading issues under heavy cluster load.
enableNoisyContextsPolicy.title: enableNoisyContextsPolicy

enablePolexPolicy.description: If enablePolexPolicy is true, this chart will deploy an additional ClusterPolicy which rejects PolicyException objects created outside of the namespaces listed in allowedPolexNamespaces.
enablePolexPolicy.title: enablePolexPolicy

enableWildcardMatchPolicy.description: Matching all (*) kinds results in excessive and unnecessary admission review load.
enableWildcardMatchPolicy.title: enableWildcardMatchPolicy

polexPolicyMessage.default: PolicyExceptions are not allowed to be created in the {{ request.namespace }} namespace. Please contact a cluster administrator for assistance.
polexPolicyMessage.description: The message shown to users can be customized to direct them to an exception process.
polexPolicyMessage.title: polexPolicyMessage
